input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.

Optional: Specifies the name of the interface for which you want to configure address and gateway information. The InterfaceName parameter must match the name of the interface as specified in Network Connections. If InterfaceName contains spaces

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show </xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">netsh interface ip show address</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> name="${interface name}"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/sbin/ifconfig -a</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${interface name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/sbin/ifconfig -a</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${interface name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Displays information about static IP addresses and default gateways on a specified interface.
